pros: Salary, family oriented, good bosses
cons: Medical benefits are terrible for working for a hospital.

review_title: Has the potential to be good.
pros: Good health insurance, fair pay, hours are fine if you like shift work.
cons: Short staffing, not afraid to put you in a situation with too many patients outside of your comfort zone. Required to work every weekend. Work-life balance is not good.

pros: Plenty hours to work, decent pay, and a lot of experience if you are a student.
cons: Large workload, not enough staffing to cover shifts, and your phone will ring to pick up open shifts.

pros: Many co-workers are friendly enough.
cons: lack of communication and frequent "It's all in who you know".

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Indiana, PA
pros: Decent pay for the area, but definitely not great. Decent health insurance, but definitely not great.
cons: Nurses are viewed as highly disposable and receive no respect from management. Pay is not sufficient to make a comfortable living wage as a single parent requiring daycare services.

pros: Some great people doing the work who care about patients
cons: Embarrassing CNO. CNO always looking for photo op. Hard to believe she is an RN she is very shallow and unable to answer real questions

pros: Easy work, good hours and great coworkers
cons: little growth in the company, and under paid

pros: 12 hour shifts, health benefits, good enviornment
cons: No nursing contract, mandating, and

job_title: Patient Services Representative in Indiana, PA
pros: Everyone is super friendly, management is kind and always willing to help you with anything when needed
cons: Not many cons honestly, one of the better jobs I’ve had

pros: Driven, goal oriented, patient focused
cons: Long hours, lack of recognition, abrasive work ethics

pros: They don’t care about their nurses or employees
cons: It once was a great place to work

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Indiana, PA
pros: I love my co workers and job
cons: Nothing I can think of

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Indiana, PA
pros: Always grateful for a steady job in this crazy world
cons: They're continually decreasing our benefits

pros: Caring executives that work closely with management to provide involvement and communication.
cons: Difficult time for healthcare finance

pros: Small community hospital. It’s like working with family and taking care of neighbors. Strong Nurses Union!!!  Self scheduling for most nurses positions. Hospital gets reimbursed for higher RN wages. Good insurance options thanks to Union.
cons: Management is terrible. Nurses get blamed for everything. No accountability on physician or management part. Poor retirement options. Uses a call system that calls constantly looking for staff, even when you are already at work. Could hire more ancillary staff. Primary nursing.

pros: Excellent Regional Community based hospital. Working very diligently to remain a regional facility and keep local control. Everyone has a great attitude and treats patients as I would want to be treated.
cons: Struggling to keep pace with competition in regards to equipment and technology because of the healthcare squeeze and economic times.

pros: Nice facility.  Nurses really care about the patients
cons: Very poorly run business that masquerades as a charity.  Managers are terrible.  It's a dumping ground for doctors that couldn't work anywhere else.   Upper management makes large financial blunders then tries to cut compensation and benefits to pay for them.

job_title: Patient Access Service Representative in Indiana, PA
pros: Benefits are offered to part-time employees. Overtime is possible.  Job security.
cons: An employee needs to be aware at hiring that scheduling can be a challenge and requirements to work all shifts and holidays are a part of the job.

pros: Pays decent for new phlebotomists
cons: Too many supervisors for such a small department. Lots of favoritism given to employees with seniority even though they’re productivity is nearly non existent.

pros: Easy to get along with employees.
cons: Employees think new people do not respect them.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technologist in Indiana, PA
pros: Pay the best in the area, free parking, great leadership
cons: Shift work, seniority based, work holidays, must be a good multitasker

job_title: Chief Operating Officer in Indiana, PA
pros: Engaging Leadership, Great Benefits, Corporate Vision , Balance Lifestyle
cons: Committe Driven, Declining Healthcare Reimbursements

pros: They do offer a Competitive wage
cons: Poor healthcare and is very antiquated with policies
